intro: Guatteria aberemoa var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces berries that are typically red when mature. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
